@akaRCN distinct possibility but Caps and Jackets may also have some tempting F and D in draft
@akaRCN not sure, ideal world sure they'd love to keep Korpisalo but his name was on market earlier this season so not sure they expect to
@akaRCN believe so, really steady, reliable game + been good in AHL but Korpisalo has higher ceiling, star level skills, incredible patience
@akaRCN … has lost something while trying to tighten up technically. maybe an adjustment period but some just don’t play as well structured
@akaRCN Torn on Mrazek; was too reliant on raw reactive skill + speed while having success early for it to be sustainable long term but ...

on night Henrik Sedin reaches 1,000 points + we reminisce about 1999 draft year, hope Daniel Sedin didn’t just have Patrick Stefan moment
During this penalty kill #Canucks Ryan Miller just became the 26th goaltender in NHL history to play 40,000 minutes
Roberto Luongo doing Roberto Luongo things to keep Henrik Sedin from point 1,000; lunging gloved robbery of Eriksson alone in front
@mattdubya found a *seam i mean
@mattdubya very well could have been, either way found a seem from a dead angle — this is what goalies are worried about with new pants BTW
But just to be clear, he’s not on way to hospital this time; Luongo stays in game https://t.co/Vv3Y4EzdSc
Luongo hurt by sharp angle shot; high on shoulder that wasn't square, kinda reminds of one that broke bone + almost forced Tallas into game
Don't judge Canucks fans from my free press box seat but w/ classy Sedin 1pt from 1000 vs franchise-best G Luongo 1W from 450 hope it’s full
Henrik Sedin, Alexandre Burrows + Roberto Luongo having chat while Lu stretches out in pre-game warm up; big smiles, love to hear that convo
@taizzzz5 sold me on skills over past few years; technique never been a problem and like his mindset when I get to talk to him
Fatigue, both physically + mentally, is up + little time to reset either; practice time way down so position-specific work harder to get too
With Allen left home by Blues + some uncharacteristically long No.1 slumps, interesting talks with Luongo last 2 days on impact of schedule

Great example of effectiveness of Rinne’s active glove: Daniel shoots low far pad with Henrik driving net for rebound but catches it instead
weird part on Preds jam goal is how Miller lost post; usually stable in RVH, willing to bet that’s why he’s mad but can’t see a clear push
Jets Hutchinson on Rinne stopping rims: “even if he has to jump up into the glass. I’ve seen him butterfly slide into boards, everything”
No goalie is more aggressive than Pekka Rinne stopping pucks behind his net; goes into boards in some unique positions to stop hard rims

Quincey goal also = NHL game 105 without shutout for Markstrom, who has played well; only Pokey Roddick has more career games (132) + no SO
Devils D Kyle Quincey hasn’t scored in 26 games so maybe don’t reach in on a point shot NHL goalies stop 99% of time and tip it? 1-1 after 2
@bh_ out with a bad groin injury but RT for u, hope u find a target
Ex-Preds G @cmace30 raved about Saros last night while talking for another story + I see now what all fuss is about #controlledathleticism
Feels like Miller has used that "Jonathan Quick block" as a save selection, dropping right knee + keeping glove high, a lot more this season
Gotta give Miller credit for battling through on tough night for goalies, some tough saves in tight late
@OpenUpACanShow tough spot and a tough play for sure but u either give urself best chance to make a save or not. Hasn't on few of these
@OpenUpACanShow except for not backing across crease off angle entire way (watch overhead) + never square up. that's when pucks go through u
@OpenUpACanShow I was talking about other end too actually 😳
@OpenUpACanShow been more than one stinker in this one but yeah
Yikes, some odorous goaltending at both ends tonight #Canucks #Flyers
Say what u want about style-related ups + downs but I love watching Pekka Rinne play goal, especially when he's on like tonight
